```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)

```

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
df_tab1 %>% 
	head()

df_tab1 %>% 
	ggplot(aes(indexdate, fill = exposed)) + 
	geom_histogram() +
	labs(title = "index date")

df_tab1 %>% 
	ggplot(aes(enddate, fill = exposed)) + 
	geom_histogram() +
	labs(title = "end date")

df_tab1 %>% 
	select(patid, exposed, dep, anx, depdate, anxdate) %>%
	pivot_longer(cols = c(dep, anx), names_to = "outcome") %>%
	ggplot(aes(fill = exposed)) + 
	geom_histogram(aes(depdate)) +
	geom_histogram(aes(anxdate)) +
	facet_wrap(~outcome) + 
	labs(title = "Diagnosis date")
```
